replies.body:
Ouch, that sucks!

This is how Hextech Chests work at the moment, though. The loot inside is essentially random, with the only modifier to this specific chest *guaranteeing* you a Skin Permanent. There's always still a chance that you can receive content you already own, since it's essentially an [**RNG**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Random_number_generation) system.

Let me know if you have any questions.

I will say that this sounds extremely unfair and an oversight, rather than a deliberate Riot choice.

I'll quote [Zileas' List of Game Design Anti-Patterns](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=293417), which isn't precisely the same, but it carries the gist, moreso when we're talking about Real Life Money.
> **Or We Could XXXX the Player!!1111oneoneone**
>This is where you straight up screw over the player, usually with dramatic flair, or maybe just try to make the player feel crappy in a way that isn't contributing to the fun of the game. These range in severity, but examples usually are spawned because the designer is a pretentious wanker who likes to show what a smart dude he is and how stupid the player is. I do not respect designers who engage in this pattern intentionally, and encourage any design lead out there to immediately fire any of your staff that does. I do understand that it can happen inadvertently, and that you might cause some of this stress on purpose in an RPG for character development.. And of course, I love you WoW team despite the 'playing vs' experience of Rogue and Warlock, as you DO have the best classes of any MMO, and they look even better in Cataclysm.... But, on Bayonetta, did the developers really think the stone award was a good idea? But I digress...

>Severe: There's a popular wc3 map in China where you enter a bonus round, and have a 2% chance of just straight up dying rather than getting cool loot.

I'd recommend Riot Support giving this guy a random skin permanent that they don't already own in this case. Additionally, fixing/looking over the issue to make sure that Skin Permanents rolled cannot already be owned, because seriously, **why** is this possible?

Yo I have a question about the crafting system. So if i make a new account, buy vayne and get all of vayne skins, then reroll 3 skin shards, will I get Soulstealer vayne? I mean when you reroll skin shards you get a skin PERMANENT and if vayne is the only champion i have and i already have all the other skins the the only skin that i can get is SS vayne right?

Just asking
Nope, you wouldn't be guaranteed a skin you don't own. You could still end up with a Skin Permanent for a skin you already own or for a champ you don't own yet. As I said before, it's pretty random.
